docs.title: Sales Automation- An Intro
docs.description: Generating leads for your company is the first stage of the sales cycle. Any product improvements may have prompted several leads to visit your website. Others may have quickly skimmed your website to see whether you are providing what they need. You'll save a lot of time if you can swiftly collect the lead information when they visit your product website or landing pages.

docs.title: Basics of Design Research
docs.description: - The study of consumer behavior is one of the most common examples of research in design.

docs.title: Basic Commands

docs.title: Edit a POD
docs.description: Remember, you CANNOT edit specifications of an existing POD other than the fields below:

docs.title: Microservices
docs.description: At times you may need two micro services which were developed and deployed separately to work together such as a web server and a logging service. And that is why you have multi container pods that share the same lifecycle which means they are created together and destroyed together. They share the same network space which means they can refer to each other as local host and they have access to the same storage volumes.

docs.title: Node Affinity
docs.description: nodeSelector provides a very simple way to constrain pods to nodes with particular labels.

docs.title: Node Selection
docs.description: You have different kinds of workloads running in your cluster.

docs.title: Resources
docs.description: The Scheduler that decides which node a part goes to.

docs.title: Scheduling
docs.description: A scheduler takes care of placing new pods onto nodes within the cluster.

docs.title: Secrets
docs.description: - Convert your secret data to a base-64 representation

docs.title: Security Context
docs.description: SecurityContext is one option to make sure that containers and pods don't request more than what it should request in terms of process privileges.

docs.title: Services
docs.description: Single-point entry to access one/more pods because

docs.title: Deployment and StatefulSet
docs.description: Similarities and Differences

docs.title: Storage Classes
docs.description: Volumes are used by pods to store data.

docs.title: Taints and Tolerations
docs.description: Taints and tolerations are used to set restrictions on what pods can be shared.Taints and tolerations have nothing to do with security or intrusion on a cluster.

docs.title: Big Data Analytics and Autonomic Computing in Anticipating Operating System Threats
docs.description: A major portion of the world’s population now has Internet access, with the number of connected devices currently in the billions. The decline in the cost of hardware resources, especially the cost of storage devices, is one factor that enables organizations to store every bit of data, leading to the accumulation of data in volumes unimaginable. Traditional network perimeter defense systems become ineffective in resisting targeted attacks as they are not scalable to the size of organizational networks.

frontMatter.title: Big Data Analytics and Autonomic Computing in Anticipating Operating System Threats

docs.title: Chaos Theory on  COVID-19
docs.description: The term chaos is used when there is some change taking place that cannot be explained by classical physics.
